content: The term "brain rot" refers to the perceived negative impact of short-form video content (like TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts) on attention spans and cognitive abilities.
The video will analyze the scientific evidence regarding the effects of short-form video on attention, including debunking common myths and explaining relevant cognitive psychology experiments.
The video will clarify what researchers mean by "attention span" and distinguish the unique characteristics of infinite scroll and autoplay feeds from older media formats.
The video will discuss the limitations of lab tests in fully understanding the mental effects of short-form video.
